abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, and sustainability likely, though the
            institutional development impact is negligible. Among the
            lessons learned, it is suggested that a bold approach may be
            required to help a country overcome problems stemming from
            inadequate performance, poor track record, and lack of
            international support. Taking this into account, the project
            proved valuable in that it constrained allocations, to be
            disbursed against actual implementation of the critical
            reforms designed to address the problems at the core of poor
            performance, and, subsequently, reforms would test the
            Government's determination to re-build external
            confidence. This highly risky operation required the close
            collaboration between the International Monetary Fund, and
            the Bank, given Cameroon's extremely tight financial
            situation, and the different timelines of the policy reform
            agenda, supported by the two institutions. This approach
            forged a constructive dialogue with the Government, and
            built a mutual understanding of the challenges ahead, which
            despite the policy dialogue's difficulties sector-wise,
            such collaboration strengthened the country team, and placed
            sectoral issues in a proper perspective. In addition, the
            decline of budget allocations to priority sectors, was a
            major factor in the deterioration of economic, and social
            infrastructure, but the critical, though minimum level of
            funding, initiated the recovery process, which set the stage
            for a deeper analysis of issues pertaining to service
            delivery, and the time-consuming process of reform.
